intro: Tilingia tsusimensis, commonly known as the Japanese snowbell, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It belongs to the family Styracaceae and is characterized by its clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Tilingia tsusimensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
